definitions.definition: used to describe somebody/something appearing to be somebody/something else

examples.text: They were all dressed as clowns.
The bomb was disguised as a package.

definitions.definition: used to describe the fact that somebody/something has a particular job or function

examples.text: I respect him as a doctor.
You can use that glass as a vase.
The news came as a shock.
She had been there often as a child *(= when she was a child)*.

wordOrigin: Middle English: reduced form of Old English alswā ‘similarly’ (see also).
